DASF

class dasftoolbox.dasf.DynamicPlotParameters(tau: int = 10, show_x: bool = True, show_xTY: bool = True, X_col: int = 0, XTY_col: int = 0, Y_id: int = 0)[source]

Parameters for dynamic plots.

tau

Sampling period for the dynamic plot.

Type:

int

show_x

Flag to show the current estimate of X, i.e., the filter weights.

Type:

bool

show_xTY

Flag to show the current estimate of X.T @ Y, i.e., the filtered signal, per sample.

Type:

bool

X_col

Index of the column of X (i.e., the filter) to be plotted.

Type:

int

XTY_col

Index of the column of X.T@Y (i.e., the filtered signal) to be plotted for the filtered signal.

Type:

int

tau: int = 10
show_x: bool = True
show_xTY: bool = True
X_col: int = 0
XTY_col: int = 0
Y_id: int = 0
apply_correction(nb_filters: int, nb_samples: int) → DynamicPlotParameters[source]

Function ensuring that parameters are set correctly, and making modifications if necessary.

class dasftoolbox.dasf.DASF(problem: OptimizationProblem, data_retriever: DataRetriever, network_graph: NetworkGraph, dasf_convergence_params: ConvergenceParameters, updating_path: ndarray | None = None, initial_estimate: ndarray | None = None, rng: Generator | None = None, solver_convergence_parameters: ConvergenceParameters | None = None, dynamic_plot: bool = False, dynamic_plot_params: DynamicPlotParameters | None = None)[source]

Base class for the DASF algorithm.

problem

The optimization problem to be solved.

Type:

OptimizationProblem

data_retriever

The data retriever object retrieving data for the optimization problem.

Type:

DataRetriever

network_graph

The network graph representing the sensor network.

Type:

NetworkGraph

dasf_convergence_params

The convergence parameters for the DASF algorithm.

Type:

ConvergenceParameters

updating_path

The path followed to select updating nodes.

Type:

np.ndarray | None

initial_estimate

The initial estimate for the optimization problem.

Type:

np.ndarray | None

rng

Random number generator for reproducibility.

Type:

np.random.Generator | None

solver_convergence_parameters

The convergence parameters of the provided optimization problem. Adds an additional degree of freedom to select different parameters than the ones used by the centralized solver.

Type:

ConvergenceParameters | None

dynamic_plot

Flag to enable dynamic plotting during the algorithm run.

Type:

bool

dynamic_plot_params

Parameters for dynamic plotting.

Type:

DynamicPlotParameters | None

centralized_solution_for_input(problem_inputs: ProblemInputs | list[ProblemInputs], initial_estimate: ndarray | list[ndarray] | None) → ndarray | list[ndarray][source]

Solves the centralized problem, used for comparison.

Parameters:

  • problem_inputs (ProblemInputs | list[ProblemInputs]) – The inputs of the problem.

  • initial_estimate (np.ndarray | list[np.ndarray] | None) – The initial estimate for the problem.

Returns:

The solution to the centralized problem.

Return type:

np.ndarray | list[np.ndarray]

property X_estimate

Final estimate of te optimal solution using DASF.

Returns:

The final estimate of the optimal solution using DASF.

Return type:

np.ndarray | None

property normed_difference_over_iterations

`||X^{i+1}-X^i||_F^2/MQ

Type:

Returns the sequence

Type:

math

property normed_error_over_iterations

Returns the sequence ||X^i-X^*||_F^2/||X^*||_F^2

property absolute_objective_error_over_iterations

Returns the sequence |f(X^{i})-f(X^*)|

property total_iterations

Returns the number of iterations performed during the run.

run() → None[source]

Main method to run the DASF algorithm. Values summarizing the result are stored in various attributes of the class.

plot_error() → Figure[source]

Plots the sequence ||X^i-X^*||_F^2/||X^*||_F^2

plot_error_over_batches() → Figure[source]

Plots the sequence ||X^i-X^*||_F^2/||X^*||_F^2 at the end of each batch of data

plot_iterate_difference() → Figure[source]

Plots the sequence ||X{i+1}-X^i||_F^2/X.size

plot_objective_error() → Figure[source]

PLots the sequence |f(X^{i})-f(X^*)|

get_summary_df() → DataFrame | None[source]

Returns a pandas DataFrame summarizing the simulation results.

class dasftoolbox.dasf.DASFMultiVar(problem: OptimizationProblem, data_retriever: DataRetriever, network_graph: NetworkGraph, dasf_convergence_params: ConvergenceParameters, updating_path: ndarray | None = None, initial_estimate: list[ndarray] | None = None, rng: Generator | None = None, solver_convergence_parameters: ConvergenceParameters | None = None, dynamic_plot: bool = False, dynamic_plot_params: DynamicPlotParameters | None = None)[source]

Class inheriting from the DASF class and implementing the DASF algorithm for a setting with multiple variables.

problem

The optimization problem to be solved.

Type:

OptimizationProblem

data_retriever

The data retriever object retrieving data for the optimization problem.

Type:

DataRetriever

network_graph

The network graph representing the sensor network.

Type:

NetworkGraph

dasf_convergence_params

The convergence parameters for the DASF algorithm.

Type:

ConvergenceParameters

updating_path

The path followed to select updating nodes.

Type:

np.ndarray | None

initial_estimate

The list of initial estimates for the optimization problem, one for each variable.

Type:

list[np.ndarray] | None

rng

Random number generator for reproducibility.

Type:

np.random.Generator | None

solver_convergence_parameters

The convergence parameters of the provided optimization problem. Adds an additional degree of freedom to select different parameters than the ones used by the centralized solver.

Type:

ConvergenceParameters | None

dynamic_plot

Flag to enable dynamic plotting during the algorithm run.

Type:

bool

dynamic_plot_params

Parameters for dynamic plotting.

Type:

DynamicPlotParameters | None

property normed_difference_over_iterations

`||X^{i+1}-X^i||_F^2/MQ

Type:

Returns the sequence

Type:

math

property normed_error_over_iterations

Returns the sequence ||X^i-X^*||_F^2/||X^*||_F^2

run() → None[source]

Main method to run the DASF algorithm in a setting with multiple variables.
